definition: to climb (by pulling oneself up)/to implicate/to claim connections of higher status

sentences.english: They made their way through a jungle woven with creepers and vines .
sentences.chinese: 他們穿過一個被攀援植物和藤蔓植物纏繞的叢林。

sentences.english: Jasmine and climbing plants are placed in some large ceramic pots.
sentences.chinese: 茉莉和攀援植物被種植在一些大型的陶器中。

sentences.english: The tendrils of climbing plants are thigmotropic.
sentences.chinese: 攀援植物的卷鬚就有向觸性。

sentences.english: The wall is covered all over with ivy.
sentences.chinese: 那些常春藤攀援而上，爬滿了整面牆。

sentences.english: The water polishes the rock "like glass."
sentences.chinese: 流水將岩石沖刷得像面玻璃，以致於她很難向上攀援。

sentences.english: Consciousness is always focused on objects.
Old World climbing plant with hard-shelled bottle-shaped gourds as fruits.
sentences.chinese: 舊大陸攀援植物，有硬殼的瓶狀果實。

sentences.english: He trembles , but must investigate as high as he can climb.
sentences.chinese: 他顫抖，但必須儘可能的向高處攀援。

sentences.english: Climbing plants clothed the courtyard walls.
sentences.chinese: 攀援植物給院牆披上了綠裝。

sentences.english: Now tower built beside the ladder, you can climb themselves up.
sentences.chinese: 現在塔旁建有云梯，可以攀援而上。

sentences.english: I will never resemble scrambling trumpet creepers.
Most vertical afforestation can be achieved by with the climber material.
sentences.chinese: 垂直綠化大部分是通過攀援植物來實現。

sentences.english: The flora of climbing plants in Shandong had stronger tropical genetic relation.
sentences.chinese: 攀援植物區系具有更強的熱帶性親緣。

definition: to climb over/to get over (difficulties)/to scale/to surmount
to climb (by pulling oneself up)/to implicate/to claim connections of higher status
to climb/to pull oneself up/to clamber/to scale/fig. to forge ahead in the face of hardships and danger
to climb (of climbing plants)/to creep/to cling on to/fig. to seek connection (with the rich and powerful)/social climbing
Kaoshu township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
Boston ivy or Japanese creeper (Parthenocissus tricuspidata)
